intro: Haplanthus tentaculatus var. neilgherryensis, commonly known as the Neilgherry haplanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its botanical features include a slender, herbaceous stem and a unique floral structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
